location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no. 1586 of 1822 from Secretary to Government of Bombay to Lieutenant John MacLeod, Resident in the Persian Gulph [Gulf]

mods.abstract: Informs MacLeod that the Deputy Persian Secretary has been instructed to provide him suitable presents to take with him for taking charge of the appointment of Resident in the Persian Gulf. Enclosed is a list of presents for the Prince of Sheeraz [Shiraz], the Imaum of Muskat [Imam of Muscat, Sa‘īd bin Sulṭān Āl Bū Sa‘īd], the Shaikh of Bushire, the Shaikh of Buhrain [Bahrain, ‘Abdullāh bin Aḥmad Āl Khalīfah] and 'For eventful purposes (Meerzas [Mirzas], Moonshee [Munshi] and of the Petty Chieftains)'. Presents include various kinds of gun and pistols, fabrics, watches, a musical box, telescopes, penknives, and pairs of spectacles.
